intro: Pedicularis spicata subsp. spicata, commonly known as the spiked lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and semi-parasitic plants. This subspecies is characterized by its upright, sparsely branched stem and clusters of bright yellow to orange-red flowers. The leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often covered with fine hairs. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
